rComments: June's class is set up w/ checkpoints to keep you accountable (readings + written responses, attendance). You can tell she really wants you to get something out of her class! Reasonable w/ the work she assigns/the tests she gives, and has a vast repertoire of knowledge to share from her travels and research. Great teacher, super interesting class!!

June is one of my favorite teacher. I think I picked the wrong major, or I should have at least minored in Education.  What can I say? I just love June, she is the greatest. Not much reading, just articles on ecommons. VERY interesting class on Asian Immigrants and how they have affected the American educational system.

Really knowledgeable about so many things related to Asian culture, provides clear and comprehensible assignments that makes it pretty easy to do well in the class. Seriously, you'd have to try NOT to do well. Take Professor Gordon if you get the chance!

June Gordon is AMAZING. My level of interest before this class was so low, but after, she really made me appreciate education and all the cultural aspects of education in different cultures. She is an amazing professor, enthusiastic, and always willing to help/chat. HIGHLY recommended!

Beautiful mature woman..class was very interesting...she shared lots of personal stories that tied perfectly into the class..very sweet and helpful by far the best prof at ucsc... she is very smart and has the experiences to back it up.... the best..can't leave ucsc without taking her class.
she was super nice. made the class very interesting using her own experiences but didn't go off in tangents. she made us write a lot but it was insightful. final paper was tough.
